intro: Mitracarpus frigidus var. genuinus, commonly known as the Arctic buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its small, yellow, cup-shaped flowers and hairy, low-growing foliage. The plant thrives in cold, rocky environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. This variant is distinguished by its genetic differences from the typical Mitracarpus frigidus.
